intro: Asterochlaena hieronymi var. montana, commonly known as the mountain asterochlaena, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
